page.title: 08DISUSED MINES DUKINFIELD
page.content: In the Nineteenth Century Dukinfield was a mining village where houses had been built for the mining families. However,'{Dewsnap Deeps'}were eventually closed down and the waste coal was covered over with earth. Houses and schools were built on top of the old mines but there was always the worry of gas seeping up into buildings from beneath the ground. When there was heavy rainfall the gas was pushed up out of the ground,making for a hazardous situation. Consequently,when {All Saint's High {School'}was built over the site of one of these mines it was thought necessary to install sensitive alarms to detect any such leakage which are monitored by a computer. If there is a build up of gas the school has to be evacuated and the fire brigade called in to disperse it.
